# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = []
    for word in split(text)
        if length(word) + sum(length.(lines)) > text_width
            push!(lines, "")
        end
        push!(lines, word)
    end
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
text = "Hello there, how are you today? This is a very long sentence that should be wrapped at the specified text width."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 20)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This function splits the input `text` into words and iterates over them. For each word, it checks if adding it to the current line would exceed the specified `text_width`. If so, a new line is started. After all words have been processed, the resulting lines are joined with a newline character (`"\n"`) to create the wrapped text.
